intro: Ranunculus fertilis, commonly known as the fertile buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers with 5 to 15 petals, which bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with trifoliate leaves that are deeply lobed. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Ranunculus fertilis is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along streams, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
